title: Disappearing animations and  weird game speed
body:
I was playing league yesterday and the game worked perfectly, and when I was finished, I shut my computer down for the night. When I turned my computer on the next day and played a couple of games to confirm what I saw, I noticed that my game seemed to sort of lag/frameskip [even though the numbers showed no sign of this], thus making animations show up late, or happen fast, almost like the game speed was at 1.5 instead of 1 (for instance I was ganked and the enemy jungler started moving to me faster than he was supposed to normally). I also noticed that Ekko’s Timewinder would disappear once it expanded in the animation, and the circles that appear to show the passive sometimes weren’t there either. Please someone help, I keep losing games because of this. 

EDIT: I tried restarting my computer a couple of times and it fixed the timewinder problem but the speed thing still happens

replies.body:
Is it possible that your internet connection is being compromised? Try resetting your router, or perhaps unplugging it temporarily can fix it. I had this quite a while back, but it turned out it was a problem on Riot's end, and they fixed it pretty fast since everyone was experiencing it. Your internet is the only thing I can think of that could cause that issue.

Are you currently on an ethernet connection, or are you wirelessly connected to the internet? If you are using wireless, I would recommend testing out an ethernet connection, since that will be much more stable, and might fix the issue or possibly even lower your ping.

Since you're mostly seeing delays in actions and missing actions or items in-game, I'm inclined to agree with FluffCow that this is likely tied to your connection to the League servers. In this case, I'd like you to work through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure all your local settings are in line before we take a look at this further.

Hit me up if you still see these issues after taking those steps.
